sense.name: settlement of people distant from their homeland
sense.examples: The colony resented taxation without representation. He grew tired of socializing with the American colony in Paris. The colonies could not initially agree on the wording of their declaration to the king.

sense.name: localized population of organisms living together
sense.examples: The biologist has studied various ant colonies for many years. The island supports a healthy colony of seals.

sense.name: settlement of people with a common circumstance
sense.examples: Mary lived in an artists colony during her early twenties. It was a famous leper colony of the sixteenth century. The novel is set in a penal colony in Siberia.

sense.name: geographic region governed politically by a distant nation
sense.examples: The region between those two rivers was a former French colony in the 19th century. Their new world colonies were rich in natural resources such as gold, timber and coal.

sense.name: group of organisms grown from a single parent cell
sense.commentary: COLONY[+entity][+group][+organism][+generated][+parent][+single] Note: either single cells or single spores
sense.examples: Under the microscope, the slide revealed a colony of bacteria. Antibiotics attack the friendly colonies of bacteria in the intestines. A colony of mushrooms sprang up overnight under the tree in the back yard.
